note.p: Burial: Church of Weston, near Bath, Somerset; monumental inscription in Bath Abbey
Education: Pembroke College, Cambridge (admitted 1714); MB (1720), MD (1725); Leyden (admitted 1720)

Career: Practised in Plymouth; moved to Bath (1725); Physician to the Bath Mineral Water Hospital (1741-1760); inventor of the Bath Oliver biscuit; shortly before his death he gave the recipe, along with ten sacks of the finest wheat flour and Â£100, to his coachman, who set up shop and made a fortune
Proposers: William Derham, William Rutty, Cromwell Mortimer
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Innes Smith; Venn
